body.p: Shows the status of a running Greenplum Database system.

section.title: Description
section.p: The gpstate utility displays information about a running Greenplum Database instance. There is additional information you may want to know about a Greenplum Database system, since it is comprised of multiple PostgreSQL database instances (segments) spanning multiple machines. The gpstate utility provides additional status information for a Greenplum Database system, such as:

ul.li: Master and segment configuration information (hosts, data directories, etc.).
The ports used by the system.
A mapping of primary segments to their corresponding mirror segments.

plentry.pd: Optional. Display a brief summary of the state of the Greenplum Database system. This is the default option.
The number of segments to check in parallel. If not specified, the utility will start up to 60 parallel processes depending on how many segment instances it needs to check.
Optional. Display mapping of primary segments to their corresponding mirror segments.
Optional. The master data directory. If not specified, the value set for $MASTER_DATA_DIRECTORY will be used.

Show details on primary/mirror segment pairs that have potential issues such as 1) the active segment is running in change tracking mode, meaning a segment is down 2) the active segment is in resynchronization mode, meaning it is catching up changes to the mirror 3) a segment is not in its preferred role, for example a segment that was a primary at system initialization time is now acting as a mirror, meaning you may have one or more segment hosts with unbalanced processing load.
Display details of the standby master host if configured.
Display the Greenplum Database software version information for each instance.
The directory to write the log file. Defaults to ~/gpAdminLogs.
Optional. List the mirror segment instances in the system, their current role, and synchronization status.
List the port numbers used throughout the Greenplum Database system.
Optional. Run in quiet mode. Except for warning messages, command output is not displayed on the screen. However, this information is still written to the log file.
Optional. Checks segment status in the system catalog on the master host. Does not poll the segments for status.
Optional. Displays detailed status information for the Greenplum Database system.
Optional. Displays error messages and outputs detailed status and progress information.
Optional. Displays detailed information about the progress and state of a Greenplum system expansion.

section.title: Output Field Definitions
section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -s for the master:

table.title: gpstate output data for the master

row.entry: PID of the master database listener process
file system location of the master data directory
port of the master postgres database listener process

dispatch = regular operating mode
utility = maintenance mode

Standard = one NIC per host
Multi-Home = multiple NICs per host
version of Greenplum Database when system was first initialized
version of PostgreSQL that Greenplum Database is based on
host name of the standby master
status of the standby master: active or passive

section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -s for each segment:

row.entry: file system location of segment data directory
port number of segment postgres database listener process
current role of a segment: Mirror or Primary
role at system initialization time: Mirror or Primary

status of a primary/mirror segment pair:
Synchronized = data is up to date on both
Resynchronization = data is currently being copied from one to the other
Change Tracking = segment down and active segment is logging changes
when in Change Tracking mode, the size of the change log file (may grow and shrink as compression is applied)
when in Resynchronization mode, the estimated size of data left to synchronize
when in Resynchronization mode, the estimated size of data that has already been synchronized
When in Resynchronization mode, the estimated percentage of completion
when in Resynchronization mode, the estimated time to complete
status of postmaster.pid lock file: Found or Missing
PID found in the postmaster.pid file
a segment port lock file for its postgres process is created in /tmp (file is removed when a segment shuts down)
active process ID of a segment
segment status as reported in the system catalog: Up or Down
status of Greenplum Database to incoming requests: Up, Down, or Suspended. A Suspended state means database activity is temporarily paused while a segment transitions from one state to another.

section.p: The following output fields are reported by gpstate -f for standby master replication status:

table.title: gpstate output data for master replication

row.entry: file system location of the standby master data directory
port of the standby master postgres database listener process
process ID of the standby master
status of the standby master: Standby host passive
write-ahead log (WAL) streaming state: streaming, startup,backup, catchup
WAL sender transaction log (xlog) record sent location
WAL receiver xlog record flush location
